If the harddrive of the laptop requires formatting first in a specific way document how to do this also.<br>If final settings are required make a manual how to enter those final settings</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="font-weight:700">Operating System</span><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> </span></p><ul class="lst-kix_vqwnd4d5lpyf-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Linux - Ubuntu 18.04 or latest</span></li></ul><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Hardware Requirement</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_ukf672s9cpei-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Disk space: 600MB for the Moodle/Video server/ProjectProgram codes, plus as much as you need to store content. 250GB is probably a realistic minimum.</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Processor: 1GHz (min), 2GHz dual core or more recommended.</span></li><li style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Memory: 512MB (min), 1GB or more is recommended. 8GB plus is likely on a large production server</span></li></ul><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Steps</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal"> – the software that we are going to use to create a bootable style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal"> or balenaEtcher, is primarily used to write image files like .img and .iso files to create a bootable USB flash drive.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal"> </span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Here is how to make a Ubuntu Bootable USB flash drive with Etcher (balenaEtcher)</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 1: Download the latest Ubuntu ISO file</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_zhu9zjfh5ab8-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400">To download the </span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700">Ubuntu</span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400"> ISO file, you can get it here: </span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#1e73be;font-weight:400"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.ubuntu.com/download/desktop&sa=D&ust=1611126796070000&usg=AOvVaw0MuLhvhepPu_Q_lVgF1piC" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">https://www.ubuntu.com/download/desktop</a></span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Go ahead and copy and paste the link above to a browser</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400">Look for the version of </span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700">Ubuntu 18.04 LTS</span><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal"> and go ahead and click Download.</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">As per Ubuntu’s website, please take note of the recommended system requirements:</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_6oynlhr8mr6h-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">2GHz dual core processor or higher</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">4GB system memory</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">25 GB of free hard drive space</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">USB port for the installer media</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Preferably with internet access</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 2: Download the latest Etcher</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_c78r92d2vrg1-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400">If you do not have the Etcher yet, you can get it here: </span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#1e73be;font-weight:400"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.balena.io/etcher/&sa=D&ust=1611126796072000&usg=AOvVaw3QzclRuC3wofhfL34Fza_k" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">https://www.balena.io/etcher/</a></span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Click Download</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Once the download has finished, double click on the file</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">The Installation Wizard will be launched, just follow the steps accordingly.</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 4: Plug in your USB flash drive to your laptop or computer’s USB port</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_wnuz7bcf1pjr-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Go ahead and plug the USB flash drive to your laptop and computer’s USB port</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Make sure that the USB flash drive has 2GB of storage or larger</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">P.S.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">To avoid confusion, make sure to only plug in the USB flash drive that you are going to use to create a bootable USB flash drive. And since we are going to write on your USB flash drive, do not forget to back it up otherwise the content will be deleted.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 5: Select the Ubuntu ISO file</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_6kabbchkuge8-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Once you have launched Etcher, click on “Select image”</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Go ahead and locate the Ubuntu ISO file that you have downloaded earlier (usually this is saved on your Downloads folder not unless you have saved the file on a different location)</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 6: Select the Drive</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_gyioams48xx7-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Go ahead and click “Select Drive”</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Choose the USB flash drive that you are going to use to create a bootable USB</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">P.S.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">If you have multiple USB flash drives plugged into your laptop or computer, make sure that you have checked the name of the drive where the USB flash drive is plugged into. You do not want to choose the incorrect one. Remember, all files will be deleted.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:18pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">If you only have one USB flash drive plugged into your laptop or computer, Etcher will automatically detect and have the device pre-selected.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 7: Double check your selection</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_jswnzf1rpu7u-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Before we proceed with the flashing process, go ahead and double check first that you have selected the correct Ubuntu ISO file</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">And then also double check that you have selected the correct device</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Step 8: The Flashing Process</span></p><ul class="lst-kix_af4ja4py3nh0-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Once you are sure that you have all the correct selection, go ahead and click the flash image</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">The flashing process will now then start and a progress bar will be shown directly below the flash image</span></li><li style="padding-top:0pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">Once the flashing process is completed, it will let you know that the flash is complete</span></li></ul><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.15;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400">So, there you have it. You have successfully made a Ubuntu bootable USB with </span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:700">Etcher</span><span style="color:#3a3a3a;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">!</span></p><p style="padding:0;margin:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

page.title: 10.3.1.2 Selecting Manual partition scheme
page.contents:
<html><head><meta content="text/html; charset=UTF-8" http-equiv="content-type"><style type="text/css"> @import url(https://themes.googleusercontent.com/fonts/css?kit=fpjTOVmNbO4Lz34iLyptLcWpXo_CmM6erK5IinBZ-8PVus-cM8ZA-pXCeyO7rfhH96xlbbE5D7Gw2o7jubnkMA); ol.lst-kix_r456n852bn2i-4.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_r456n852bn2i-4 0}.lst-kix_lqn4qjri3x5y-0 > li{counter-increment:lst-ctn-kix_lqn4qjri3x5y-0}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6 > li{counter-increment:lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6}ol.lst-kix_gmiw55mg1mu4-7.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_gmiw55mg1mu4-7 0}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-0 > li:before{content:"● "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-0{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6 > li:before{content:"" counter(lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-6,decimal) ". "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-2{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-2 > li:before{content:"■ "}ol.lst-kix_t7kdp41k84uk-5.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_t7kdp41k84uk-5 0}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-1{list-style-type:none}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-4{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-1 > li:before{content:"○ "}.lst-kix_y0m8r9d8a104-3 > li:before{content:"● "}ol.lst-kix_e4x4wu5kor0l-3{list-style-type:none}.lst-kix_wsoboy172f2i-7 > li:before{content:"" counter(lst-ctn-kix_wsoboy172f2i-7,lower-latin) ". style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">So at the very first step, we have to create a bootable DVD/USB media from which we can start our installation.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">If you don’t know how to create a bootable DVD or USB drive then you should go through chapter 10.3.1.1 above. </span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select a USB drive from the boot menu, and wait for Ubuntu to load.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 1: Choose your language</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">And this is the first screen you see when Ubuntu is loaded. Here you are selecting a language, and whether you want to try Ubuntu first or go to the installation.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">You can start installing by clicking the Install Ubuntu button:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step2: Choose your keyboard layout</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Here you need to select the keyboard that will be used. It is recommended that you select the starting point as shown in the picture below (choose your own language and keyboard):</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 3: Minimal installation</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Note the first option for a minimal installation. If you choose this option, you will get Ubuntu that only has an Internet browser and basic programs. We will be using this option</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; height: 243.50px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 4: Partitioning</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Since this instruction refers to an installation with an explanation for creating partitions, we select the option Something else.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 454.00px; height: 258.00px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image63.png" style="width: 454.00px; height: 258.00px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 5:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Since you have an empty hard disk on your computer, it will be displayed right under the name /dev/sda. You need to create a new partition table by clicking New Partition Table …</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 492.00px; height: 253.00px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image104.png" style="width: 492.00px; height: 253.00px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 6:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">You will see a warning saying that if you continue any existing partitions (if any) you will be deleted. height: 253.00px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 14</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select the location where you are.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 15</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Enter information, such as your name, the computer name you selected, your username and password. Remember a good username and password because you will need it when working with Ubuntu.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Also, here you choose whether the password will be required when the system is turned on or the user will be turned on automatically when someone comes in and turns on the computer.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828"> </span><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 513.00px; height: 226.50px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image94.png" style="width: 513.00px; height: 226.50px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 16</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">And that is that. It’s not difficult, and you can learn a bit about the partitions on the hard disk and the basics of installing a single operating system based on Linux.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 514.00px; height: 288.50px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image83.png" style="width: 514.00px; height: 288.50px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

"}.lst-kix_jqyrhdk6qem9-6 > li{counter-increment:lst-ctn-kix_jqyrhdk6qem9-6}ol.lst-kix_lqn4qjri3x5y-2.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_lqn4qjri3x5y-2 0}.lst-kix_pfijw6hcd91r-6 > li{counter-increment:lst-ctn-kix_pfijw6hcd91r-6}.lst-kix_v50vyhkftluj-7 > li:before{content:"○ "}ol.lst-kix_mgv3u350gf9c-8.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_mgv3u350gf9c-8 0}ol.lst-kix_jnhxk5j1sg3h-6.start{counter-reset:lst-ctn-kix_jnhxk5j1sg3h-6 0}</style></head><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 1</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828">The first step is to download the </span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=http://clonezilla.org/download/sourceforge/&sa=D&ust=1611126796081000&usg=AOvVaw3yB6dXRuOFi5Ouo96vWSlh" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">ISO image from the Clonezilla Web site</a></span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828">Make sure you download a stable version of this tool. Once you have the file downloaded, you need to burn it onto a disk. You can follow same instruction as </span><span style="color:#666666;font-size:12pt">10.3.1.1 Make </span><span style="font-family:"Arial";color:#666666;font-weight:700">Ubuntu Bootable USB with Etcher</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 2</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Attach the external drive (or, if you are using a USB, insert a burnable CD/DVD) and then insert your Clonezilla media.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 3</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Reboot. You have to boot from the Clonezilla media for this to work. You will have to change to  boot mode using the F9 key, if you are using hp notebook.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828">What you will see is the Clonezilla boot screen (</span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700">Figure A</span><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">). For the task of creating an image, you will want to select Clonzezilla Live (Default settings) and press Enter. You will now see a Debian boot sequence appear.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Figure A</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 504.00px; height: 298.83px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image20.png" style="width: 504.00px; height: 298.83px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">You can select a resolution to better suit your monitor from this menu.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 4</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose your language. From the language screen, you need to select the language you want to use for the process. This step should be fairly self-explanatory.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 5</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose your keyboard layout. You have four options:</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Keyboard from arch list</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Don't touch my keymap</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Keep kernel keymap</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select keymap from full list</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Most likely the Don't Touch My Keymap setting will work just fine</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 6</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Start Clonezilla. At this step you can either drop into a console or start Clonezilla. You don't want to use console here, unless you are a seasoned Clonezilla veteran.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 7</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828">Choose your device image. In this step you are going to choose between creating an image or doing a direct, device-to-device copy. Creating an image is always best, especially for a first-time clone or backup. Since we are creating an image of our drive, select the first option (</span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700">Figure B</span><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">) and tab down to OK.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Figure B</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 504.00px; height: 328.83px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image15.png" style="width: 504.00px; height: 328.83px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Both methods do clone/restore, but only one method creates an image of your drive.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 8</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Where do you want to put the image? In this step you need to tell Clonezilla where the image should be saved. You have six choices:</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Local Device</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">SSH server</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Samba server</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">NFS Server</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Enter shell</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">         </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Skip</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828">For an external or USB drive, you will want to select local_dev (</span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700">Figure C</span><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">). This destination is also the easiest, as you do not have to worry about setting up SSH, Samba, or NFS. Just remember that these images can get VERY large, so you will want to have an external drive that is greater than or equal to the drive you are imaging.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Figure C</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose a destination, but local_dev is the most likely choice.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 504.00px; height: 379.00px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image72.png" style="width: 504.00px; height: 379.00px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 9</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select the repository that will hold your image. This is where you need to be very careful. If you are in a Linux environment you can almost be sure that you do NOT want to select the drive labeled like hda. You will want to look for an hdb or hdd (or sdb, sdd, etc). If you choose the "a" partition, you run the risk of overwriting your current working drive.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 10</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Name the image. All you do here is give the image a name. You might want to include the date in your image name so that you know what the most recent image file is.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 11</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Watch the process happen. Although Clonezilla is pretty snappy (for an imaging tool), you can expect anywhere from 30 minutes to three hours, depending on the size of the partition or drive you are imaging. I recently did a clone of a 160GB drive in just under two hours.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Once the image has written to the device, you can then reboot your machine, knowing you have a backup in case of disaster.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

page.title: 10.3.3 Mounting Partitioned Image to 2nd Notebook
