style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 1</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Attach the external drive (or, if you are using a USB, insert a burnable CD/DVD) and then insert your Clonezilla media.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 2</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Reboot. You have to boot from the Clonezilla media for this to work. You will have to change to  boot mode using the F9 key, if you are using hp notebook. (Steps 1 through 7 are as above)</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828">What you will see is the Clonezilla boot screen (</span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700">Figure A</span><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">). For the task of creating an image, you will want to select Clonzezilla Live (Default settings) and press Enter. You will now see a Debian boot sequence appear.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Figure A</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 504.00px; height: 298.83px;"><img alt="" src="http://bo.nts.nl/docs_extract_new/documentFiles/Copy2 of C001 Moodle tutorial/images/image20.png" style="width: 504.00px; height: 298.83px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);" title=""></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">You can select a resolution to better suit your monitor from this menu.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 3</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose your language. From the language screen, you need to select the language you want to use for the process. This step should be fairly self-explanatory.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 4</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose your keyboard layout. You have four options:</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select Keyboard from arch list</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Don't touch my keymap</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Keep kernel keymap</span></p><p style="padding:0;color:#000000;font-size:10pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:14pt;text-indent:13pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left"><span style="color:#282828">·</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">                      </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select keymap from full list</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Most likely the Don't Touch My Keymap setting will work just fine</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 5</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Start Clonezilla. At this step you can either drop into a console or start Clonezilla. You don't want to use console here, unless you are a seasoned Clonezilla veteran.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 6</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose your device image. In this step you are going to choose between creating an image or doing a direct, device-to-device copy. </span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 7</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Since we choose "local_dev" option, we can use 2nd disk or USB flash drive to save 1st disk's image. If using a USB flash drive as a repository, insert a USB flash drive and wait a few seconds.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Clonezilla will scan the disks on the machine in every few secs, and show you the results:</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Once you see the device you have inserted shown on the status, you have to press Ctrl-C to quit the scanning report.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 8</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;font-size:11pt;color:#282828">Select sdb1 as image repository, then choose "restoredisk" option     </span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose the directory name on /dev/sdb1 as the image repository. Here we put image on the top directory (i.e., Current selected dir name is "/"):</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">If you are not familiar with the disk or partition name in GNU/Linux, read the hints:</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="background-color:#ffffff;font-size:11pt;color:#282828">'The partition name is the device name in GNU/Linux. The first partition in the first disk is "sda1", the 2nd partition in the first disk is "sda2", the first partition in the second disk is "sdb1" or "sdb1"... If the system you want to save is MS windows, normally C: is sda1, and D: could be sda2, or sda5...'</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:6pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 9</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Here we choose "Beginner" mode:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-size:11pt">If you choose "Expert" mode, you will have some chances to choose advanced parameters, e.g. imaging program, compression program, etc.. You can see more details </span><span style="text-decoration-skip-ink:none;font-size:11pt;-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;text-decoration:underline"><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://clonezilla.org/clonezilla-live/doc/02_Restore_disk_image/advanced/09-advanced-param.php&sa=D&ust=1611126796093000&usg=AOvVaw1T_CpGFJSGVuwOTARn7kO-" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">here</a></span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">. Now you can select "restoredisk" option:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 10</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose the Clonezilla live image as source image:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select the destination disk "sda" we want to restore:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Choose to check the image integrity before really restoring the image to disk sda:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">It's recommended to check the image before restoring it. You will not know if the image is broken or not. If you are really sure about the integrity is OK, then of course you can choose "-scr" to skip checking.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 11</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Select the mode you want after the image restoring is done:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">By default we will choose later, but if you have decided, you can choose to reboot or poweroff the machine.</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Clonezilla will prompt us the command to restore the image. This command is very useful when you want to create a customized Clonezilla live:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Before starting to restore the disk image to disk sda, Clonezilla will ask you to confirm that TWICE:</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Step 12</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Clonezilla now is restoring the selected disk image to 1st disk (sda). The job is done by restoring:</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Courier New";color:#282828;font-weight:400">o</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">    </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">MBR (by dd), and Boot loader (by grub)</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Courier New";color:#282828;font-weight:400">o</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">    </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Partition table (by sfdisk).</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.15;margin-right:0;background-color:#ffffff;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-family:"Courier New";color:#282828;font-weight:400">o</span><span style="font-size:7pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";color:#282828;font-weight:400">    </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Data on every partition or LV (logical volume) (by partimage, ntfsclone, partclone or dd. It depends on the image of each partition or LV.)</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><div>
</div> </body>
</html>

style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">You can as well use command line to check if the file exist;</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">Sudo ls -a  /<name of partition>/<di>r/</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;height:10pt;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"></span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.1500000000000001;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-size:11pt">For example <br></span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:11pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">$ sudo ls -a /mnt/dummyDir/*</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal"> Files should be listed if present</span></p><p style="padding-top:11pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:11pt;line-height:1.15;background-color:#ffffff;font-family:"Calibri";orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:700">$ sudo cat > /mnt/dummyDir/file_name.txt </span><span style="color:#282828;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Calibri";font-style:normal">to test if it opens</span></p><p
